title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Ryan Bank’s liabilities are $10,000 and/or does not explain that demand deposits are a bank’s liabilities.
The response states that Ryan Bank’s liabilities are $10,000 and explains that demand deposits are a bank’s liabilities.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply can increase throughout the banking system as $140,000 and/or does not show the work.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the central bank should sell bonds and/or does not explain that the open-market sale will cause the money supply to decrease and the nominal interest rate to increase.
The response states that the central bank should sell bonds and explains that the open-market sale will cause the money supply to decrease and the nominal interest rate to increase.
